intro: Camptacra barbata, commonly known as the barbed camptacra, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. Its leaves are ovate and often have a pubescent surface, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Camptacra barbata is adapted to grow in dry, open habitats and is often found in disturbed soils.
